episode_title: 117 - The One With Two Parts, Part 2

content.description: An Emergency Room, Rachel and Monica enter. Rachel is limping and leaning on Monica for support.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow. Ow. Ow. Ow.
(They reach the desk. The bored nurse thinks she’s heard it all before.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Uh, my friend here was taking down our Christmas lights, and and she fell off the balcony and may have broken her foot or or ankle or something.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: My god. You still have your Christmas lights up?
(Rachel glares at the nurse, who gives Monica a form attached to a clipboard.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Fill this out and bring it back to me.
(Monica helps Rachel over to a vacant seat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow.
(Monica starts on the form, while Rachel catches her breath and massages her ankle.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, ooh, alright. Name, address… Okay, in case of emergency, call?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that is so sweet. (Touched, she puts an arm around her friend and kisses her.) Oh gosh, love you. Insurance?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, check it. Definitely, I want some of that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: you don’t have insurance?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why, how much is this gonna cost?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have no idea, but X-rays alone could be a couple hundred dollars.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wel-wel-well what are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well there’s not much we can do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um… unless, unless I use yours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hah, no no no no no no no no no no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: well, now, wait a second, who did I just put as my “In case of emergency” person?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s insurance fraud.
content.parenthetical: Looking around to check that no-one’s listening, then lowering her voice anyway

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, alright, then, forget it. (Getting up to go) Might as well just go home. Ow ow ow ow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, okay. I hate this.
content.parenthetical: Jumping up to make Rachel sit down

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. Thank you. I love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, (tiny laugh) um, I’m gonna need a new set of (tiny laugh) these forms (tiny laugh).

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am really an idiot. (Tiny laugh) you see, I was filling out my friend’s form, and instead of putting her information, (tiny laugh) I put mine.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: You are an idiot. (She hands over a blank form).

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: yep, that’s me, (tiny laugh) I am that stupid (tiny laugh).

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, has split up his newspaper so Joey can look at the funnies, while Ross’s inappropriate joke at Lamaze class has come back to haunt him.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had a dream last night where I was playing football with my kid.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: That’s nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, with him. (He mimes holding the baby like a football.) I’m on this field, and they, they hike me the baby… and I, I know I’ve gotta do something ’cause the Tampa Bay defence is comin’ right at me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tampa Bay’s got a terrible team.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right, but, it is just me and the baby, so I’m thinkin’ they can take us. And so I uh, hah-hah, I just heave it down field.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you crazy? That’s a baby!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He should take the sack?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, suddenly I’m down field, and I realise that I’m the one who’s supposed to catch him, right? Only I know there is no way I’m gonna get there in time, so I am running, and running, and that, that is when I woke up. See I, I am so not ready to be a father.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you’re gonna be fine. You’re one of the most caring, most responsible men in North America. You’re gonna make a great dad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, Ross. You and the baby just need better blocking.
(Feeling a little better, Ross fetches more coffee.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, have either one of you guys ever been to the Rainbow Room? Is it real expensive?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, only if you order stuff.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m takin’ Ursula tonight. It’s her birthday.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wo-wo-whoa. What about Phoebe’s birthday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When’s that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, man. What’re the odds of that happening?
(Joey begins to contemplate his ill fortune.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You take your time.
(Joey looks at his friends, thinks a bit more, then realises.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There it is! So what’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What can I do? Look, I don’t want to do anything to screw it up with Ursula.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And your friend Phoebe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, if she’s my friend, hopefully she’ll understand. I mean, wouldn’t you guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, if you tried something like that on my birthday, you’d be starin’ at the business end of a hissy fit.
(Joey gestures to show that he wouldn’t dare…)

content.description: The Hospital, Monica and Rachel are waiting for the doctors to arrive. They enter and are played by Noah Wyle and George Clooney.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: ..you add a pinch of saffron, it makes all the difference.
(They approach the young ladies. Dr. Mitchell consults Ms.Geller’s admissions form.)

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Okay, errrr, Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes? (jumping as Rachel punches her arm) ..yes, she is.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Hi, err Rachel. I’m Dr.Mitchell.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: And I’m his friend, Dr.Rosen.
content.parenthetical: Smiling even more and attempting to take over

content.text: (Monica and Rachel smile back prettily.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aren’t you a little cute to be a doctor?

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I meant er, (struggling to concentrate) young, young, I meant young, young to be a doctor. Oh good, Rach.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone but Joey is waiting for Phoebe to arrive for her surprise birthday party. Rachel and Monica is telling Chandler about Rachel’s incident.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ..so, he said it was just a sprain, and that was it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, you left out the stupid part.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not stupid. The very cute, cute, cute doctors asked us out for tomorrow night, and I said “yes.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think it’s totally insane, I mean, they work for the hospital. It’s like returning to the scene of the crime. You know, I say we blow off the dates.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Monica, they are cute, they are doctors, (spelling it out in the air for her slow friend) cute doctors, doctors who are cute!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, what have we learned so far?

(There is a knock at the door. Someone turns the music off, then the whole party runs and hides, except for Monica and Rachel who answer their door. Ross stands in the doorway, holding a box, but everyone is too keyed up to notice that it’s him.)

content.speaker: The Whole Party
content.text: SURPRISE!!!
(Ross is so startled that he throws his arms up to defend himself. The box takes off, then lands with a squishy thud, its contents oozing out onto the floor. Ross is not pleased.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the hell are you doing? You scared the crap outta me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Was that the cake?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah. I got a lemon schmush.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, she’ll be here any minute.
(The whole party gathers round as Ross puts the box on the coffee table.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I hope it’s okay.
(As Ross opens the lid, everybody looks at the mess inside.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: “Happy Birthday Peehe.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well maybe we can make a, a, a ‘B’ out of one of those roses.
(Phoebe quietly wanders in, to join the tableau.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, we’ll just use our special cake tools.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, we just…

content.speaker: Phoebe’s Friends
content.text: Surprise!
content.parenthetical: Finally noticing the guest of honour

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: oh, oh, oh! This is so great! Oh my god! This was not at all scary. Hi everybody. Hi Betty! Betty, Hi! (Thrilled) You found Betty! Oh my god! (Hugging people) This is great. Everybody I love is in the same room, (still happy) Where’s Joey?
(The party falls flat. Chandler tries to think of a witticism, but even he can’t help…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you see Betty?
(Betty waggles her fingers to say “Hi”, but Phoebe feels her birthday has been ruined by her twin.)

content.description: A Restaurant, Ross is having lunch with his father who is examining his next forkful.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I tell you one thing, I wouldn’t mind having a piece of this sun-dried tomato business. Five years ago, if somebody had said to me, here’s a tomato that looks like a prune, I’d say “get out of my office!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, before I was born, did you freak out at all?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’m not freaking out, I’m just saying, if somebody had come to me with the idea andndash;

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, dad, dad, I’m talkin’ about the whole uh, baby thing. Did you uh, ever get this sort of… panicky, “Oh my god I’m gonna be a father” kind of a thing?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: No. Your mother really did the work. I was busy with the business. I wasn’t around that much. Is that what this is about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, Dad, I was just wondering.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: ’Cause there’s time to make up for that. We can do stuff together. You always wanted to go to that Colonial Williamsburg. How ‘bout we do that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks, Dad, really, I ju… you know, I just, I just needed to know, um… when did you start to feel like a father?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh, well, I, I guess it musta been the day after you were born. We were in the hospital room, your mother was asleep, and they brought you in and gave you to me. You were this ugly little red thing, and all of a sudden you grabbed my finger with your whole fist. And you squeezed it, so tight. And that’s when I knew.
(Ross is so moved by his father’s charming story, that he stops eating.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: So you don’t wanna go to Williamsburg?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, we can go to Williamsburg.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Eat your fish.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is just getting off of the intercom and turns off the TV which is still in the SAP mode.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, the cute doctors are here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, coming!
(Monica opens the door for Dr. Mitchell and Dr. Geoffrey.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, come on in.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Geoffrey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: Ah here, we brought wine.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Look at this, it’s from the cellars of Ernest and Tova Borgnine, so how could we resist?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that’s great. Look at that.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: So, Monica, how’s the ankle?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s uh…
(Rachel discreetly coughs to warn her.)
(Rachel joins Monica who is in the kitchen area, opening the wine bottle. Rachel checks that the doctors aren’t listening, then lowers her voice anyway.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, listen, I’m thinking, why don’t we just tell them who we really are? I mean, it’ll be fine, I really think it’ll be fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It will not be fine. We’ll get in trouble.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Monica! Would you stop being such a wuss ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A wuss? Excuse me for living in the real world, okay?
(Back at the couch, Dr. Mitchell and Dr. Rosen have concerns of their own.)

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: So… they sss-still seem normal.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: That’s because they are.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: okay, but you have to admit that every time we go out… Women we meet at the hospital… It turns into…

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Willya relax? Look around. No pagan altars, no piles of bones in the corners, they’re fine. (Baring his teeth to clean them with his finger) Go like this. (Dr. Rosen obeys.)
(Meanwhile, back at the sink.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I said we are not going to do it, okay? Sometimes you can be such a, a big baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am not a baby! You know what? I swear to god, just because you get so uptight every time we…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure, every time, you’re such a princess…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What!?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What!!?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Every day, you are becoming more and more like your mother.
(Rachel brightly limps back across the apartment with glasses of wine for the cute doctors, leaving an open-mouthed Monica in her wake.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello! Here we go!

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: This is a great place. How long have you lived here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks! I’ve been here about six years, and Rachel moved in a few months ago.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah… (joining the others) ..see, I was supposed to get married, but, um, I left the guy at the altar.
(Rachel tries to hide her alarm, but she squirms in her chair.)

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah… Yeah, I know it’s pretty selfish, but haha, hey, that’s me. (Indicating a dish on the table) Why don’t you try the hummus?

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: So, Monica, what do you do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aahh, I’m a… chef at a restaurant uptown.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: Good for you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah it is, mostly because I get to boss people around, which I just love to do.

content.speaker: Dr. Rosen
content.text: This hummus is great.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: God bless the chickpea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (Suddenly laughing) Oh, god, I am so spoiled… That’s it!
(The doctors don’t know what to make of all this.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And by the way, have I mentioned that back in high school, I was a cow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I used to wet my bed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I use my breasts to get other people’s attention.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (Revealing her anger to point at her best friend) We both do that!

(Rachel lets her anger show too. Hideously embarrassed, the doctors drain their glasses in the vicious pause which follows. The telephone rings, but the girls just glower at each other, silently daring the other to move first. Finally both guys jump up, and Michael wins.)

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Err yeh, aayah, yeh, just one second… (handing it to Monica) ..ah, Rachel, it’s your dad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Dad. No, no, it’s me. (Getting up to move further away from Rachel) li-listen, Dad, I can’t talk right now, um, but there’s something, um… there’s something that I’ve been meaning to tell you…
(Monica glares triumphantly across the room, scaring Rachel who also stands up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you excuse me for a second?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Remember back in freshman year? (Talking fast before Rachel can catch her) Well, Billy Dreskin and I had sex on your bed.

(Completely undone by Monica’s verbal destruction, Rachel almost loses her balance as she staggers backwards, eyes agog, gasping for breath, and literally not knowing which way to turn. Finally, she escapes into the bathroom while a resigned Dr. Mitchell looks philosophically at Dr. Rosen who seems about remind him of the good old days at the pagan altar.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, Ross, Phoebe, Chandler and Monica sit round the coffee table, playing Scrabble. Rachel, still in her dressing gown, is pleading on the phone, her free hand shaking with agitation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Daddy… Daddy… Daddy, why whyyy would I sleep with Billy Dreskin? His father tried to put you out of business! (Rachel turns to Monica, clasping the receiver to her bosom so Dr.Green can’t hear, while mouthing “You are…”) …dead!
(Monica smiles a sweet apology of regret, until she’s distracted by Marcel as he clambers all over her nice furniture.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, he’s got the remote again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good. Maybe he can switch it back.
(Marcel changes channel to Bugs Bunny, who is speaking in Spanish.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe not.
(Meanwhile, Rachel has taken another call, from a nurse she’d hoped never to hear from again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Um, yeah, uh, (snapping her fingers at Ross who takes the remote from Marcel, then turns off the TV) Okay ah, hold on a second, lemme lemme just check and see if see if she’s here.
(All animosity forgotten, Rachel holds the receiver out as she limps quickly over to her friend, who stands up in concern.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s the woman from the hospital admissions office. She says there’s a problem with the form. Oh, god, oh god…

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Oh god, waddawe do, waddawe do, waddawe do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know! Why don’t you just explain? What do they want? Find out what they want!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay (desperately hands the receiver over) no, you do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello, this is Monica… Yeah??? Oh… (Smiles at Rachel to reassure her) Okay, yes, we’ll be right, we’ll be right down.(Listens) Thank you. (Hangs up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We forgot to sign one of the admissions forms.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh… (slumping in relief) Okay, you were right. You were right! This was just not worth it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, let me just change.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.
(Rachel goes to her room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Trouble?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your sister stood me up the other night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no. Don’t you hate it when people aren’t there for you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well did you try calling her ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve been trying for two days. When I called the restaurant, they said she was too busy to talk. I can’t believe she’s blowin’ me off.
(Phoebe wants to be angry with Joey, but as she watches him shaking his head in pain and disbelief, she knows that it isn’t his fault.)

content.description: Riff’s, Phoebe is entering. Ursula returns with two plates of chicken, but she only has time to set one on the table, when…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.
(Ursula turns in surprise.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um you, you got a minute?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Um, yeah, I’m just… (waving dismissively at the concept) ..working.

(Ursula points out a vacant table, so the twins walk over, side by side, to sit down. Departing customers walk right past the pair. Sitting at the back, a hungry gentleman looks most annoyed as Ursula sets his meal down in front of her. The girls sit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Uh-huh.
(Ursula is genuinely pleased that her sister has visited her, after so many years. Phoebe hesitates over how best to begin.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, oh, I got you a birthday present.
(Ursula picks up a fork and begins eating the meat, while Phoebe removes a present from her bag.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh, wow! You remembered! (Opening it) Oh! It’s a Judy Jetson thermos!
(She laughs at the childhood memory. Phoebe smiles at being able to make her point.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right, like the kind you…

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right… Oh, I got something for you, too.
(Ursula gets up to fetch a box from her bag by the counter.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How’d you know I was coming?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Um, yeah, um, twin thing.
(Ursula puts the box directly into Phoebe’s hand. Phoebe brightens.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you did this.
(Phoebe opens the box, to find something familiar inside.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you… (holding up Joey’s cardigan) ..did this.
(Phoebe’s smile hardens as she packs the cardigan away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So… What’s the deal with umm, you and Joey?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh, right. He is so great. But that’s over.
(Ursula resumes eating her lunch..)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does he know ?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey. You know, um, he’s really nutsy about you.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: He is? Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You got me.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right.
(A waiter comes over for the stolen chicken. Ursula turns to him.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Excuse me. Doesn’t this come with a side salad?
(The man gives up, shaking his head.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, um, are you gonna call him?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: What? (Indicating the departing waiter) Do you think he likes me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, Joey .

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh. No, no, he is so smart. He’ll figure it out. (Offering to share her food) Do you want some chicken?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. No food with a face.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: You have not changed!
(Ursula’s eyes dance as she laughs and smiles, simply glad to be back with her sister.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, you too.

(Trying not to wrinkle her nose, Phoebe smiles back realising it’s down to her to make up for her negligent sister. Meanwhile, Ursula still hasn’t received her side salad, but when she attempts to attract the waiter’s attention, he ignores her.)

content.description: The Emergency Room. The officious admissions nurse is again on duty. Rachel and Monica enter, looking worried. As they approach the desk, Rachel adopts a winning smile, while Monica struggles to smile at all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, remember us?

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Mmm hmmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, okay. You just called a little while ago about needing a signature on the admissions form. Well, it turns out we need a whole new one (little laugh) because uh, you see, I-I, I put the wrong name again. (Little laugh) ’cause um…

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: You’re that stupid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am. I’m that stupid. (Little laugh.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and and, I’m just gonna pay for this with a check .

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Well, you know your insurance will cover that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know… (mirroring her friend) ..I’m I’m just not that bright either.
(The girls escape with a new form.)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is neglecting the game of Scrabble, for he’s busily drawing on his own childhood in an attempt to help Ross. Marcel chitters about.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, worst case scenario. Say you never feel like a father.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Say your son never feels connected to you, as one. Say all of his relationships are affected by this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you have a point?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, you think I would.
(Instead of scampering, Marcel stretches his neck as much as possible, and makes an unvoiced noise from his throat.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s up with the simian?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s just a fur ball.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay… (returning to the board) ..whose turn is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yours, I just got 43 points for ‘KIDNEY’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, you got zero points for ‘IDNEY’.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had a ‘K’. Where’s where’s my ‘K’?
(The unvoiced hissing continues. In alarm, Ross and Chandler look at the monkey, who is now in some distress.)

content.description: The Emergency Room, Monica sits with Rachel, who is filling out an honest form at last. Ross and Chandler hurtle in. Little Marcel, wrapped in a fluffy towel, is cradled in Ross’s arms. They dash up to the admissions desk. Ross is frantic.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ve got to help me my monkey swallowed a ‘K’!
(Hearing her brother’s voice, Monica gets up to stand behind Chandler, followed by Rachel.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: You go get that animal outta here .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no you don’t understand the animal hospital is way across town he’s choking I don’t know what else to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s goin’ on?
(Ross and Chandler turn at the voice…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Marcel swallowed a Scrabble tile.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.
(..then turn back to the desk when the surprise hits them, and Ross and Chandler whip around once more. Monica and Rachel recoil slightly.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Excuse me… This hospital is for people!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Lady, he is people. He has a name, okay? He watches Jeopardy! He he touches himself when nobody’s watching. Please, please have a heart!
(Ross’s vigorous protest is attracting attention.)

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: I’ll take a look at him.
(Rachel, Monica, Ross and Chandler whip around for a second time, in formation.)

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Oh, thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Michael.

content.speaker: Dr. Mitchell
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.
(Monica smiles to cover her embarrassment, but Rachel sadly looks away…)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is playing “She Loves Me, She Loves Me Not” with the petals of a flower, alternately looking hopeful and annoyed. Phoebe enters, but not as herself, for she has changed the style of her hair and make-up to match that of her twin sister. She hangs up her coat, revealing her new cardigan. Nervously, she smooths out the identifying garment, approaching Joey who sits next to the main sofa.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Urse…
(Phoebe nods as he stands up in delight.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ..ah, what’re you doing here? I’ve been trying to call you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen, um…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, don’t say “listen.” I know that “listen.” I’ve said that “listen.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t get it. What happened? What about everything you said under the bridge?
(Phoebe is almost thrown by this.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: : Yeah, um… (nervously clears her throat) You know you, you should just forget about what I said under the bridge, I was talkin’ crazy that night, I was so drunk!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t drink.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right, I don’t… But I was, I was drunk on you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, Urse… (He tries to take her in his arms, but she fends him off.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, yeah, so it’s not gonna work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why? Is it because I’m friends with Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If it was, would you stop hanging out with her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: no. No, I, I couldn’t do that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, then yes, it’s ’cause of Phoebe! So, you know, it’s either her or me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then, uh, then I’m sorry.
(He sinks to the sofa, saddened by Ursula’s ultimatum, while Phoebe follows, touched by Joey’s good heart.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know… (unconsciously putting a hand on his knee) You’re gonna be really, really hard to get over.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know…
(He looks up at her face and Phoebe, slipping out of character, smiles back at him. Joey’s voice becomes soft and warm.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know whether it’s just ’cause we’re breakin’ up or… what, but you have never looked so beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Oooh… (she’s sprung.)

content.description: The Hospital, Marcel lies on the operating table while recovering from the anaesthetic, tucked up under a sheet like an infant in a huge bed. Ross sits beside him, as a smiling Chandler, Monica and Rachel look on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He looks so tiny.
(The door bursts open, and Joey and Phoebe rush in.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We just got the message.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is he alright?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. The doctor got the ‘K’ out. He also found an ’m’ and an ‘O’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We think he was trying to spell out ’mONKEY.’
(Ross does not approve of Chandler’s daft theory.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, the doctor says he’s gonna be fine, he’s just sleeping now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you feel like a dad yet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, come on, you came through, you did what you had to do. That is very dad.
(Ross does approve of this, but he’s still not sure. The tiny figure stirs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, look, he’s waking up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: hey, fella! How you doing?

(All of a sudden, Marcel grabs Ross’s finger with his whole fist, and he squeezes it, so tight, that Ross finally knows what it is to be a father. He looks up at his friends, who smile encouragingly, Rachel tenderly resting her chin upon Monica’s shoulder. Ross realises that Chandler was right and he’s gonna make a great dad!)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone except Joey is there. Rachel is looking out of the window and Ross is handing out some Chinese takeout. There’s a small SAP in the corner of the screen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aqui est�. (Here it is!)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: �A qui�n pidio el pollo General Tso? (Who ordered General Sal’s chicken?)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: �Pudo aver sido General Tso! (It could’ve been General Sal!)
(Rachel points out of the window.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: �Mira, mira, el viejo desnudo est� haciendo el hula hoop! (Look, look, Ugly Naked Guy is doing the hula!)
(The others rush to the window for a look.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: �Ewww! (Ewww!)
(Joey enters, happy again.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: �Hola, Joey! (Hi, Joey!)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: �Hola, amigos! (Hey, everybody!)
(Marcel grabs the remote.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mira, Ross, Marcel se llevo el control remoto. (Look, Ross, Marcel’s got the remote.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: �Lo que sucedio es que no le gusta la tele! (The thing is, he doesn`t like the program!)
(Everybody laughs.)
Chandler’s hand sports a plaster.
Joey looks at the comic strips.
Rachel pays with a cheque.
